description: Update documentation to reflect the new plan ingestion and parsing feature.

instructions: Review the provided input artifacts, including the RFC, design document, and relevant source code (`plan_parser.py`), to understand the plan ingestion and parsing feature.
Locate the existing documentation files `docs/usage.md` and `docs/internal_process.md`.

Update the `docs/usage.md` file to include a new section or modify an existing one to explain how users can provide a JSON plan file to the runner. This should cover command-line arguments or configuration options for specifying the plan file path.

Update the `docs/internal_process.md` file to add a new section detailing the runner's internal process for ingesting, parsing, and validating AI-generated JSON plans. Describe the flow from reading the file to validating its structure and content.

In both updated documentation files, clearly explain the expected JSON plan file format. Refer users to the relevant JSON schema files (`src/ai_whisperer/schemas/task_schema.json` and `src/ai_whisperer/schemas/subtask_schema.json`) and explain their purpose.
Document how validation errors are reported to the user when a provided JSON plan file is invalid. Explain the types of errors users might encounter and how to interpret them.
Ensure the language is clear, concise, and easy for users and contributors to understand.
Review the updated documentation for accuracy and completeness based on the implemented feature.
constraints: Only modify the specified output files (`docs/usage.md`, `docs/internal_process.md`).
Maintain the overall structure and style of the existing documentation.
validation_criteria: docs/usage.md is updated to mention JSON plan input and how to provide it.
docs/internal_process.md includes a dedicated section describing the plan ingestion, parsing, and validation process.
Documentation clearly explains the expected JSON plan file format and references the task and subtask schema files.
Documentation explains how plan validation errors are reported to the user.
The updated documentation is clear, accurate, and easy to understand.
